resources.string: \n1. Select your instrument from the options provided.

\n2. Choose the string you want to tune by selecting the corresponding radio button. The strings are numbered from 1 to 3 or 1 to 6, depending on the instrument. Note that the first string of your instrument is the one closest to the ground.
\n4. The current frequency of the played string will be shown at the bottom left as well.
\n3. Once you\'ve selected the string, the note and frequency to which you should tune the string will be displayed at the bottom left of the application.

\n6. In the center of the application, there will be an instrument that serves as an arrow, with the upper part of the instrument pointing in the direction. If the instrument points upward, it means the string is in tune.
\n7. Surrounding the instrument, there is a red arc that will turn green when the string is properly tuned.

\n5. The top middle of the application will display the current note of the played string. To the left of that, you will see the note that comes before the current note, and to the right, the upcoming note.
